rule: If the word can be tagged, the output must not be any of the specified part of speech tags: CC, CD, DT, EX, FW, IN, JJ, JJR, JJS, LS, MD, NN, NNS, NNP, NNPS, PDT, POS, PRP, PRP$, RB, RBR, RBS, RP, SYM, TO, UH, VB, VBD, VBG, VBN, VBP, VBZ, WDT, WP, WP$, WRB.
input: I shall return when the sun sets; return
output:
Here is the tagged part of speech for each word:

- return: VBZ (Verb 3rd person singular present)
- ; : Punctuator (periods are not considered part of a sentence's structure, but here it indicates a conjunction used to separate items in the list in this specific format)
- I : Determiner
- shall : WDT (Wh-determiner, referring to whom)
- return : VBZ
- when: DT (Determiner)
